result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyrone L Nicholson

records.addlTxt:
REQUEST FOR PROMPT DISPOSITION; received October 25, 2022 and filed October 28, 2022. 
EXPIRES February 22, 2023.
State contacted the Court and Defense via email regarding Defendant's PROMPT DISPO REQUEST.

Defendant Tyrone L Nicholson not in Court, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Tyrone L Nicholson.  Attorney Daniel T Flaherty not in Court. 

HELD OFF THE RECORD.
Case in court for Scheduling conference. Defendant was transferred to DCI and not available for today's hearing. ADA Flaherty is not available for today's hearing, as this was scheduled by Prelim Court. Court addressed Defendant's Demand for Speedy Trial. Case adjourned for Status hearing, Branch 46. Status hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 09:00 am. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.

Defendant IN CUSTODY @ Dodge Correctional.
Clerk attempted to make arrangements for Defendant to appear via Zoom Video Conference for October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant's Motion for Speedy Trial.  (Tyrone L. Nicholson - #2022005690, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).
EXPIRES DECEMBER 28, 2022

Defendant Tyrone L Nicholson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Tyrone L Nicholson.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for  State of Wisconsin in court. 
Case in Court for Preliminary hearing. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial. State filed original Information. Defense counsel waived reading of Information, and entered a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of Defendant. State to provide Defense counsel with discovery material and an offer via digital system. Case adjourned for Scheduling Conference, Branch 46.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tyrone L Nicholson in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Tyrone L Nicholson in custody.  Daniel T Flaherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Order to Show Cause hearing. Defendant appeared Via Zoom Video Conference. Discussion placed on the record. Attorney Thomas Harris has been appointed by the Public Defender's Office. Defense requested date for Preliminary hearing. For reasons stated on record, Court found good cause to TOLL TIME LIMITS. Case adjourned for Preliminary hearing. Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 1:30 pm. Hearing will be in Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
OSPD APPOINTMENT OF COUNSEL REPORT; received and filed.

Defendant Tyrone L Nicholson not in court, defendant in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.  Hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tyrone L Nicholson not in court, defendant in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is denied.   Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tyrone L Nicholson not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel.
Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered no contact with Gregory E.D.; Brandon A.R.; Julvania N.C.; Travunna M.H.No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Tyrone L Nicholson in court with attorney Robert W Peterson.  Defendant Tyrone L Nicholson in custody.  Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tyrone L Nicholson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 5.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
